summary: The Aerial Firefighting Enhancement Act of 2025 amends the Wildfire Suppression Aircraft Transfer Act of 1996. It reauthorizes the Department of Defense to sell aircraft and parts for wildfire suppression, broadening the permissible use of these resources to include water, not just fire retardant. The bill also specifies the period for exercising this authority, beginning October 1, 2025, and ending October 1, 2035.
